definition: to tighten the strings (of a musical instrument)
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
pipa strings, made from sinews of large crane or swan 鵾雞|鹍鸡[kun1 ji1]
widowed/lit. broken string, cf 琴瑟[qin2 se4] qin and se, two instruments epitomizing marital harmony
abbr. for Yupian 玉篇[Yu4 pian1] and Guangyun 廣韻|广韵[Guang3 yun4]
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
ancient bamboo reed instrument/Chinese shawm (probably related to central Asian zurna)
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
lit. to tune one's zither then play it; fig. to live by the consequences of one's actions/to make one's bed then lie on it
ink slab and sitting mat/place where one studies and teaches
